intro: Galium monanthon, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium monanthon is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator plant for certain ecological conditions.
